column4: my processor is I686. ubuntu keeps on installing I386. Should I care or am I just wasting chasing ghosts?
, should be fine. check apt-get afterwards
(i think) i found one of the boot options was for a 686 kernel. can't remember. normally you ahve to type linux26 at the boot cd prompt or something. maybe not on ubuntu tho
both kernels are on the server disk I think
